Definition at line 556 of file OVBROWSE.CPP.

void VBrowse::init (  int    inX1,
int    inY1,
int    inX2,
int    inY2,
int    recWidth,
int    recHeight,
int    totalRec,
BrowDispFP    dispFunc,
BrowDetectFP    detectFunc = NULL,
int    dispFrame = 1,
int    minInterSpace = MIN_INTER_SPACE
)  [virtual]
 

<int> x1, y1, x2, y2 = the coordinations of the list box <int> rec_width = record area width (0 if get the maximum width) <int> rec_height = record area height <int> totalRec = total no. of records (for generating scroll bar indicator)

<BrowDispFP> dispFunc = The pointer to function which will return the content of the record. When call this function a <int> rec_no parameter will pass to it. [int] dispFrame = whether display a frame highlighting current item or not (default : 1) [int] minInterSpace = minimum inter-record space (default : MIN_SPACE)

Definition at line 97 of file OVBROWSE.CPP.

void VBrowse::open (  int    recNo = 1,
int    newTotalRec = -1
)  [virtual]
 

Open the list box

[int] recNo = the initial record no. -1 if keep current record no. (default : 1, the top record)

[int] newTotalRec - new total record count. This is usually given when in INFO_UPDATE mode. (default: no change)
